title: How to Steam Asparagus in the Microwave

steps.headline: Purchase fresh asparagus.
steps.description: It's best during early spring but can be found all-year around. Choose stalks that are bright green/purple or white and are firm. Avoid limp, discolored or bruised asparagus. Frozen asparagus can be steamed, although the texture won't be as firm as steamed fresh asparagus.

steps.headline: Wash the asparagus.
steps.description: Run it under cool water. Use your fingers to remove any soil.

steps.headline: Trim the asparagus.
steps.description:

parts.name: Steaming the asparagus in the microwave

steps.headline: Dampen a few paper towels with water.
steps.description: Squeeze out excess water so the towels are moist, but not dripping wet.

steps.headline: Wrap stalks of asparagus in the paper towels.
steps.description: Grab a good bunch of asparagus and wrap it completely in a towel. Repeat until all the asparagus has been bundled and wrapped. Alternatively, place inside a microwave steamer bag available from the supermarket.

steps.headline: Lay the wrapped asparagus seam side down in the microwave.
Remove the asparagus from the microwave.
steps.description: Unroll it from the paper towels, place it in a serving dish, and serve hot. Be careful when removing the asparagus from the paper towels, since it will all be piping hot. Use tongs if necessary.

steps.headline: Add seasoning once the asparagus comes out of the microwave.
steps.description: It will taste great without this addition, since the stalks have been steamed in their own moisture, and have not lost any of their nutritional value.
